lines.text: I was tryin' to dig this well when they came.

[grabbing a handful of soil and smelling it]
You have any trouble diggin' this stuff?
Always! Black gumbo keeps oozin' into the hole.
This is why Trimble wants your ranch and all the other land in the valley.

[laughs]
There's a young fellah in the East can tell yuh. He's on his way to bein' the richest man in the world on account of it. His name is Rockefeller... John D!

[being held under gunpoint by a vengeful Nolan]
Well, why don't you get it over with?
I'm waitin' for you to beg me not to kill yuh.
Don't make it would do much good now.
I'm not so sure about that. When a man's dead, nuthin' hurts no more. There must be somethin' that hurts worse than just killin'.
Hold onto this land. Never sell Texas short. You know, what's under the ground might some day be more important to America than what's above it.
